name: "The Flash"- 2.14 "Escape From Earth-2" Online Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: How long had Harrison Wells been missing in the beginning of the episode?
questions.explanation:
4 months.

	Zoom had been searching for Wells in the opening scenes of the episode. The episode opened on Earth-2, where Wells was from. Wells had been on Earth-1 for the past several months. His Earth-1 counterpart had been killed in a season 1 episode of the series.

questions.text: Who did Cisko and Harrison have locked up when they first appeared in the episode?
questions.explanation:
Barry Allen.

	The Barry Allen they had locked up was from Earth-2. They had him locked away while the original Barry impersonated him in the previous episode. He was let go after one day when the other Barry was kidnapped.

questions.text: When Zoom attacked S.T.A.R. Labs, where did the heroes hide from him?
options: They didn't hide, they were kidnapped.
In a secret compartment under the lab.
questions.explanation:
In a time vault.

	Cisko, Harrison and Earth-2 Barry hid in a time vault that only Harrison had known about prior to them entering. Zoom actually found the vault, but the trio were behind a false wall inside the vault.

questions.text: Which villain did the team on Earth-2 track down to help them find Zoom?
questions.explanation:
Killer Frost.

	Killer Frost, the evil doppelganger of Kaitlyn Snow, had survived a fight with Zoom in the last episode. During that fight Zoom had killed both Reverb and Firestorm. Because of that fight, the team assumed that Killer Frost would be willing to help them defeat Zoom.

questions.text: With Barry on Earth-2, who filled in as "The Flash" on Earth-1?
questions.explanation:
Jay Garrick.

	Garrick actually was known as The Flash on Earth-2, before he lost his powers after experimenting on himself. Using a serum that only lasted a short time, Jay regained his powers and fought off some of the villains during Barry's sojourn to Earth-2.

questions.text: In addition to Barry and Jesse there was a third prisoner in Zoom's lair. He wasn't able to speak, how did he communicate?
questions.explanation:
Used a tap cypher system.

	The third prisoner, who wasn't known because he had a mask over his head, used an old military code to tap out letters. It took Barry and Jesse a while to figure it out. It was a complicated code.  By the time the pair figured it out, the third prisoner had only been able to tap out the word "Jay" before Zoom returned and warned them against communicating.

questions.text: Which Earth-1 metahuman infiltrated S.T.A.R. labs?
questions.explanation:
Geomancer.

	Geomancer had the power to created Earthquakes simply by punching the ground.He terrorized Earth-1 while Barry was gone. Jay was hardly able to stop him, instead he needed help to fight him each time. Geomancer was stopped during his attack on the lab when he was shot with a gun invented by Cisko.

questions.text: What was the only visual way to tell the two different Barrys apart?
options: Earth-2 Barry had a scar on his face.
questions.explanation:
Earth-2 Barry wore glasses.

	They were very different people from a personality perspective. Visually they were exact duplicates other than Earth-2 Barry needing glasses. Earth-1 Barry didn't need them because his mutated cells healed his eyesight after the accident that turned him into the Flash.

questions.text: All portals between the two worlds were closed at the end of the episode, effectively ending the interaction between the two worlds.
questions.explanation:
False.

	While the specific portal inside of S.T.A.R. Labs was closed down, it had been previously established that there were portals all over Central City. Portals opened all the time in spots where the membrane between the two worlds was thin. All of the known portals were shut down during this two episode event. It was worded in the dialogue to let the viewers know that only the "known" portals were closed, alluding to more existing.

questions.text: All three of Zoom's prisoners escaped their cells.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Jesse and Barry were able to get away after Killer Frost stepped in and attacked Zoom. However, because her cold blasts couldn't hold off Zoom forever, they were forced to leave the third, as of yet unknown prisoner behind. Barry promised to comes back and save him too.
